newsitem.title: USA: U.S. stocks extend gains, NYSE sets trading curbs.
newsitem.headline: U.S. stocks extend gains, NYSE sets trading curbs.

text.p: U.S. stocks pushed to session highs in afternoon trading on Tuesday, adopting a positive tone with help from a firmer bond market, a good outlook on inflation and hopes for a balanced federal budget.
The Dow Jones Industrial average was up 42 points at 8163, after its rise prompted the New York Stock Exchange to set curbs on index-arbitrage trading.
The Nasdaq composite rose two points to 1566 and the long bond rose 5/32 to 6.39 percent.
"It has a positive tone," BT Brokerage trader Jim Benning said. "The budget deal and data coming out have been good."
